document.masterDocTitle: Two new asexual genera and six new asexual species in the family Microthyriaceae (Dothideomycetes, Ascomycota) from China

paragraph.taxonomicName: Triscelophorus sinensis Z. F. Yu, M. Qiao & R. F. Castaneda

figureCitation.captionText: Figure 8. Triscelophorus sinensis (Holotype YMF 1.04065) a, b conidia c, d conidiophores with conidia. Scale bars: 10 µm (a-d).
Figure 9. Cultural characters of all species in this study after 20 days on PDA at 25 ° C.

subSubSection.paragraph: Latin, sinensis , referring to the country of origin, China.

Asexual morph hyphomycetous. Colonies on CMA, attaining about 1 cm diam. after 20 days at 25 °C, pale mouse grey to dark mouse grey. Mycelium superficial and immersed, composed of branched, septate, hyaline hyphae. Conidiophores macronematous, mononematous, lateral or terminal, cylindrical, erect, flexuous, separate, smooth, hyaline, up to 12-38 µm long, 1.0-2.4 µm wide. Conidiogenous cells monoblastic, cylindrical, terminal, integrated, determinate, smooth, hyaline. Conidia solitary, acrogenous, staurospore, septate, composed of a main axis and 2-3 lateral branches: i) the main axis obclavate, 2(-3)-septate, slightly constricted at the septa, straight, smooth, hyaline, 17.5-30.0 x 3.5-5.0 µm ; ii) 2-3-lateral branches obclavate, (0-)1-septate, slightly constricted at the septa, straight, smooth, hyaline, 8.5-21.0 x 3.0-4.5 µm , arising from the basal cell of the main axis arranged in a regular or irregular verticillate. Sexual state: unknown.

Triscelophorus sinensis
(Holotype YMF 1.04065) a, b conidia c, d conidiophores with conidia. Scale bars: 10 µm ( a-d ).

subSubSection.paragraph:
China
, Guangdong Province , Guangzhou , on submerged leaves, September 2011 ,
G.Z. Yang. Holotype
YMF 1.04065, preserved in a metabolically-inactive state (deep freezing) in the Conservation and Utilization of Bio-Resources in
Yunnan .

caption.paragraph: Figure 9. Cultural characters of all species in this study after 20 days on PDA at 25 °C.

subSubSection.paragraph:
In morphology,
Triscelophorus sinensis
is somewhat similar to
T. ponapensis
in conidia, both having 2-3 lateral arms ( Matsushima 1981 ). However,
T. ponapensis
has shorter (main axis: 12-26 µm ; lateral arms: 8-15 µm ) and more septate (main axis: 2-4-septate; lateral arms: 1-4-septate) conidia.
